GT.content: time gives nothing to see, is the element of invisibility
GT.linkedContent: time gives nothing to see, is the element of invisibility

GT.content: could only be a gift the instant the paradoxical instant tears time apart (what Kierkegaard means when he says decision is madness)
GT.linkedContent: could only be a gift the instant the paradoxical instant tears time apart (what Kierkegaard means when he says decision is madness)

GT.content: temporalization of time (memory, anticipation, pro, re- tention) destroys the gift
GT.linkedContent: temporalization of time (memory, anticipation, pro, re- tention) destroys the gift

GT.content: for Heidegger, importance of rethinking time, privileged horizon for reelaboration of Being
GT.linkedContent: for Heidegger, importance of rethinking time, privileged horizon for reelaboration of Being

GT.content: the es gibt plays (spielt), play of 4’s as play of gift, manifests the unity of time’s 3 dimensions, la donne de ce jeu [relance], & la doña, la femme qui nous a requis depuis l’exergue [Derrida then mentions a fine book, Finas’ Donne, which interlaces all these themes]
GT.linkedContent: the es gibt plays (spielt), play of 4’s as play of gift, manifests the unity of time’s 3 dimensions, la donne de ce jeu [relance], & la doña, la femme qui nous a requis depuis l’exergue [Derrida then mentions a fine book, Finas’ Donne, which interlaces all these themes]

GT.content: most serious stake of political economy: certain social classes have more time than others; but time cannot be given, it is certainly not time that they possess
GT.linkedContent: most serious stake of political economy: certain social classes have more time than others; but time cannot be given, it is certainly not time that they possess

GT.content: demand for term & temporization, very structure of the thing, demand for limit, boundary, margin, a demand which dawns in gift-counter-gift
GT.linkedContent: demand for term & temporization, very structure of the thing, demand for limit, boundary, margin, a demand which dawns in gift-counter-gift

GT.content: time of woman: woman’s absence [in “Counterfeit Money”] organizing the scene like a clock [?]
GT.linkedContent: time of woman: woman’s absence [in “Counterfeit Money”] organizing the scene like a clock [?]

GT.content: a gift is not signed, does not calculate w/ a time that would do it justice
GT.linkedContent: a gift is not signed, does not calculate w/ a time that would do it justice

R.content: by killing father Cronos (infinite order of time), Zeus wills out over time, touches the finitude of time, sovereignty as the instant of a decision, end to time and language
R.linkedContent: by killing father Cronos (infinite order of time), Zeus wills out over time, touches the finitude of time, sovereignty as the instant of a decision, end to time and language

R.content: annulment of time announced in date, revolution, volt of the ring (anneau), il faut le temps, default, failure, collapse [autos needing other, event, time, heteronomy]
R.linkedContent: annulment of time announced in date, revolution, volt of the ring (anneau), il faut le temps, default, failure, collapse [autos needing other, event, time, heteronomy]

SPOM.content: “time is out of joint” : both out of order and mad
SPOM.linkedContent: “time is out of joint” : both out of order and mad

SPOM.content: not a negative, broken time, but a time w/out a certain conjunction
SPOM.linkedContent: not a negative, broken time, but a time w/out a certain conjunction

SPOM.content: “[Hamlet] curses his mission: to do justice to a de-mission of time, he swears against a destiny that leads him to do justice for a fault, a fault of time and the times, by rectifying an address, a movement of correction, reparation, restitution, vengeance, revenge, punishment”
SPOM.linkedContent: “[Hamlet] curses his mission: to do justice to a de-mission of time, he swears against a destiny that leads him to do justice for a fault, a fault of time and the times, by rectifying an address, a movement of correction, reparation, restitution, vengeance, revenge, punishment”

SPOM.content: [time scrambling] threat of specter, no reassuring order of presents, no linear succession of “real time” & “deferred time”
SPOM.linkedContent: [time scrambling] threat of specter, no reassuring order of presents, no linear succession of “real time” & “deferred time”

SPOM.content: “world is going badly (le monde va mal),” il est usé mais son usure ne compte plus, vieillesse ou jeunesse [see SW pp. 322-23]—on ne compte plus avec elle, on ne s’en rend plus compte comme d’un seau âge dans le progrès d’une histoire > ce qui arrive arrive à l’âge même > messes w/ “teleological order of history”
SPOM.linkedContent: “world is going badly (le monde va mal),” il est usé mais son usure ne compte plus, vieillesse ou jeunesse [see SW pp. 322-23]—on ne compte plus avec elle, on ne s’en rend plus compte comme d’un seau âge dans le progrès d’une histoire > ce qui arrive arrive à l’âge même > messes w/ “teleological order of history”

SPOM.content: le longtemps, c’est le temps de cette chasse à l’éloignement (hunt for distance, a hunt w/ distance > pray & lure): distance hunt can only hallucinate, desire, defer proximity: lure & prey
SPOM.linkedContent: le longtemps, c’est le temps de cette chasse à l’éloignement (hunt for distance, a hunt w/ distance > pray & lure): distance hunt can only hallucinate, desire, defer proximity: lure & prey

SPOM.content: socius binds men through the interest of time, apprehension of time related to commodity-specters, time comes from difference
SPOM.linkedContent: socius binds men through the interest of time, apprehension of time related to commodity-specters, time comes from difference

BL.content: time: resolution of non-resolution—brings story into being and sustains it, only appears after law of delay, advance of law, anachrony of relation
BL.linkedContent: time: resolution of non-resolution—brings story into being and sustains it, only appears after law of delay, advance of law, anachrony of relation

MPM.content: time, memory: nothing other than figure of the marks that efface anteriority of past, “memory of the present” marks itself > only memory can recognize differential “stamp,” mark, signature, that relates a present to presence itself
MPM.linkedContent: time, memory: nothing other than figure of the marks that efface anteriority of past, “memory of the present” marks itself > only memory can recognize differential “stamp,” mark, signature, that relates a present to presence itself

POOF.content: faith, credence, credit of engagement: open experience of time

Aristotle’s bébaios [re: friendship] (temporal, becoming-intemporal, omnitemporal), stable & reliable, marks, covers over in marking, passage (through time) btwn 2 heterogenous orders: 1) assured calculable reliability 2) act of faith (reliability of oath)
POOF.linkedContent: Aristotle’s bébaios [re: friendship] (temporal, becoming-intemporal, omnitemporal), stable & reliable, marks, covers over in marking, passage (through time) btwn 2 heterogenous orders: 1) assured calculable reliability 2) act of faith (reliability of oath)

POOF.content: whole story of eidos, incl. Husserlian interp. of production of ideal objects (idealization), intemporality qua omnitemporality > [but] “takes time to do w/out time”
POOF.linkedContent: whole story of eidos, incl. Husserlian interp. of production of ideal objects (idealization), intemporality qua omnitemporality > [but] “takes time to do w/out time”

POOF.content: via Aristotle, must submit oneself to time in time like cattle, to have the habit form > history of subject as history of time
POOF.linkedContent: via Aristotle, must submit oneself to time in time like cattle, to have the habit form > history of subject as history of time

POOF.content: “O my friends…” a call, a promise, a prayer (eukhé) [neither true nor false, Aristotle] > can’t give friendship, were friendship not still to come [Heideggerian ek-stasis] > in the name of friendship, “no friend” respectfully declares the perfect sovereign friendship impossible
POOF.linkedContent: “O my friends…” a call, a promise, a prayer (eukhé) [neither true nor false, Aristotle] > can’t give friendship, were friendship not still to come [Heideggerian ek-stasis] > in the name of friendship, “no friend” respectfully declares the perfect sovereign friendship impossible

POOF.content: vous-mes-amis-soyez-mes-amis-et-bien-que-vous-ne-le-soyez-pas-encore-vous-l’êtes-déjà-puisque-je-vous-appelle-ainsi: “O my friends…” has structure & temporality of messianic teleiopoesis
POOF.linkedContent: vous-mes-amis-soyez-mes-amis-et-bien-que-vous-ne-le-soyez-pas-encore-vous-l’êtes-déjà-puisque-je-vous-appelle-ainsi: “O my friends…” has structure & temporality of messianic teleiopoesis

A.content: Diderot: mediocrity attributed as much to lack of time as lack of talent
A.linkedContent: Diderot: mediocrity attributed as much to lack of time as lack of talent

A.content: via Seneca & Diderot, one would guard jealously one’s time above all else; to “master” “my life” > know difference btwn giving one’s time & wasting one’s time
A.linkedContent: via Seneca & Diderot, one would guard jealously one’s time above all else; to “master” “my life” > know difference btwn giving one’s time & wasting one’s time

A.content: time, we have a right to be miserly about
A.linkedContent: time, we have a right to be miserly about

A.content: Heidegger thinks beyond “vulgar concept of time that privileges now,” Derrida asks: “is there anything other than vulgar time & vulgar death” [see OS]
A.linkedContent: Heidegger thinks beyond “vulgar concept of time that privileges now,” Derrida asks: “is there anything other than vulgar time & vulgar death” [see OS]

VM.content: acc. Levinas, no time, no history, w/out absolute alterity of each instant
VM.linkedContent: acc. Levinas, no time, no history, w/out absolute alterity of each instant

VM.content: “living present” : originally and forever violent, freeing of absolute alterity in absolute same > if other can only be respected/dissimulated by the same, then time is violence, living present originally marked by death > “presence as violence is the meaning of finitude, meaning of meaning as history”
VM.linkedContent: “living present” : originally and forever violent, freeing of absolute alterity in absolute same > if other can only be respected/dissimulated by the same, then time is violence, living present originally marked by death > “presence as violence is the meaning of finitude, meaning of meaning as history”

VM.content: present as absolute form of experience: pre-comprehending anticipation of Being as time, the ens of praes-ens > if Being has always been determined by philosophy as presence, the question of Being posed on basis of transcendental horizon of time > first tremor of philosophical security, of self-confident presence
VM.linkedContent: present as absolute form of experience: pre-comprehending anticipation of Being as time, the ens of praes-ens > if Being has always been determined by philosophy as presence, the question of Being posed on basis of transcendental horizon of time > first tremor of philosophical security, of self-confident presence

VM.content: for Heidegger, every epoch is erring (Irren), irreducible if Being is time and history
VM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, every epoch is erring (Irren), irreducible if Being is time and history

PAS.content: Blanchot: she guarded the hope of escape through the perspective of time
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: she guarded the hope of escape through the perspective of time

PAS.content: Blanchot: during the night she decided to become the time of men
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: during the night she decided to become the time of men

VP.content: just like in POOF w/ Aristotle’s friend, non-presence is found in Husserl where temporalization and intersubjectivity are connected
VP.linkedContent: just like in POOF w/ Aristotle’s friend, non-presence is found in Husserl where temporalization and intersubjectivity are connected

VP.content: Heidegger claims that Husserl, in The Phenomenology of Internal Time-Consciousness, breaks from Aristotelian concept of time as “point,” “now,” stigmē; Derrida clarifies that Husserl admits that lived-experience, spread out in “now’s,” never have a punctual phase, while always referring them back to a “source-point,” like a comet’s tail
VP.linkedContent: Heidegger claims that Husserl, in The Phenomenology of Internal Time-Consciousness, breaks from Aristotelian concept of time as “point,” “now,” stigmē; Derrida clarifies that Husserl admits that lived-experience, spread out in “now’s,” never have a punctual phase, while always referring them back to a “source-point,” like a comet’s tail

VP.content: “source-point,” “originary impression” which produces temporalization, is auto-affection
VP.linkedContent: “source-point,” “originary impression” which produces temporalization, is auto-affection

VP.content: for Husserl, intuition of time is a reception that receives nothing, an originary impression that engenders itself, a pure spontaneity, which creates nothing
VP.linkedContent: for Husserl, intuition of time is a reception that receives nothing, an originary impression that engenders itself, a pure spontaneity, which creates nothing

VP.content: Husserl ties concept of pure auto-affection to time
VP.linkedContent: Husserl ties concept of pure auto-affection to time

VP.content: only by means of metaphor can we describe movement from one “now” to next, borrowing its concepts from order of objects of experience temporalization makes possible
VP.linkedContent: only by means of metaphor can we describe movement from one “now” to next, borrowing its concepts from order of objects of experience temporalization makes possible

VP.content: acc. Husserl, as soon as we insert a determinate being into description of auto-affection [in time] we are speaking in metaphor,
VP.linkedContent: acc. Husserl, as soon as we insert a determinate being into description of auto-affection [in time] we are speaking in metaphor,

VP.content: time itself is a metaphor that indicates and dissimulates auto-affection, at same time
VP.linkedContent: time itself is a metaphor that indicates and dissimulates auto-affection, at same time

VP.content: “trace is relation of intimacy of the living present to its outside,” to exteriority, to the non-proper, temporalization of sense is from its very beginning “spacing”
VP.linkedContent: “trace is relation of intimacy of the living present to its outside,” to exteriority, to the non-proper, temporalization of sense is from its very beginning “spacing”

S.content: for Heidegger, time forms transcendental horizon of existential analysis

Derrida uses revenant to describe a Heideggerian passage on Trakl in spite of the metaphysical negativity Heidegger might reject in it: re-venir as the idea of an end before a beginning, originary essence of time kept under veil, guarded in its archi-origin > we are still prisoners of Aristotelian representation of time
S.linkedContent: Derrida uses revenant to describe a Heideggerian passage on Trakl in spite of the metaphysical negativity Heidegger might reject in it: re-venir as the idea of an end before a beginning, originary essence of time kept under veil, guarded in its archi-origin > we are still prisoners of Aristotelian representation of time

FSW.content: Kant’s 3 modes of times, 3 analogies of experience: permanence, succession, simultaneity
FSW.linkedContent: Kant’s 3 modes of times, 3 analogies of experience: permanence, succession, simultaneity

FSW.content: very structure of Freud’s Mystic Pad is the time of writing
FSW.linkedContent: very structure of Freud’s Mystic Pad is the time of writing

FSW.content: for Freud, erasure of trace, as movement of pure auto-affection, temporalization, makes repression “itself” possible
FSW.linkedContent: for Freud, erasure of trace, as movement of pure auto-affection, temporalization, makes repression “itself” possible

PPHS.content: movement of transcendental imagination is movement of temporalization (productive of signs and time)
PPHS.linkedContent: movement of transcendental imagination is movement of temporalization (productive of signs and time)

PPHS.content: acc. Hegel, relève of space is time, time is truer than space: what space will have meant is time [future anterior], sensory intuition of sign relevé in passage of time
PPHS.linkedContent: acc. Hegel, relève of space is time, time is truer than space: what space will have meant is time [future anterior], sensory intuition of sign relevé in passage of time

PPHS.content: signifying substance is sound, “substance of expression” [glossematicians], most proper to be produced as time itself, sound relève from naturalness, linked to spirit’s relation to itself, the voice
PPHS.linkedContent: signifying substance is sound, “substance of expression” [glossematicians], most proper to be produced as time itself, sound relève from naturalness, linked to spirit’s relation to itself, the voice

FWT.content: why figure of Hamlet?: relation of ghost and time
FWT.linkedContent: why figure of Hamlet?: relation of ghost and time

DS.content: temporal dislocation in hymen baffles decidability of different terms: is there even time, tenses, temporal differences, when there’s no central present/referent?
DS.linkedContent: temporal dislocation in hymen baffles decidability of different terms: is there even time, tenses, temporal differences, when there’s no central present/referent?

DS.content: rhythm as hymen (Dream?), “center of vibratory suspense”: soir, noir, noire, miroir, ivoire
intermission or interim of hymen does not establish time [Setareh] > non-mastery, no present in truth presents itself there
DS.linkedContent: intermission or interim of hymen does not establish time [Setareh] > non-mastery, no present in truth presents itself there

ATIA.content: since time, so long ago (depuis le temps)
ATIA.linkedContent: since time, so long ago (depuis le temps)

ATIA.content: come after the animal, named after him, this after is not in time: it’s the genesis of time
ATIA.linkedContent: come after the animal, named after him, this after is not in time: it’s the genesis of time

ATIA.content: time before time has always made “me” dizzy: God’s exposure to surprise, when God does not know what will become, what will happen when the poet names living things; Derrida feels the same way, depuis le temps, before his cat: will it/God address me?
ATIA.linkedContent: time before time has always made “me” dizzy: God’s exposure to surprise, when God does not know what will become, what will happen when the poet names living things; Derrida feels the same way, depuis le temps, before his cat: will it/God address me?

GSP.content: unlike noema, hylē is real but not intentional, sensate material of affect before intentional form, pure passivity, w/out which consciousness could not receive anything but itself, an essential opening > as temporal matter, wouldn’t it be possibility of genesis itself? irreducible complicity of time/other call “principle of principle” into question
GSP.linkedContent: unlike noema, hylē is real but not intentional, sensate material of affect before intentional form, pure passivity, w/out which consciousness could not receive anything but itself, an essential opening > as temporal matter, wouldn’t it be possibility of genesis itself? irreducible complicity of time/other call “principle of principle” into question

GSP.content: TN. auto-affection is concerned w/ time, self-generating series of present moments, leads to Derrida’s analysis of speech [Heidegger’s analysis of Kant in Kant and…]
GSP.linkedContent: TN. auto-affection is concerned w/ time, self-generating series of present moments, leads to Derrida’s analysis of speech [Heidegger’s analysis of Kant in Kant and…]

FS.content: Claudel, Proust (structuralists): neutralize surprises of nonsimultaneity, thus time becomes eternal, atemporal
FS.linkedContent: Claudel, Proust (structuralists): neutralize surprises of nonsimultaneity, thus time becomes eternal, atemporal

DPi.content: “two centuries is an infinity of eternities, and it is a fraction of a second in the history of humanity, all and nothing”
DPi.linkedContent: “two centuries is an infinity of eternities, and it is a fraction of a second in the history of humanity, all and nothing”

DPi.content: span of 50 years: eternity for the dead, a fraction of 1/1000 of a second in the history of humanity
DPi.linkedContent: span of 50 years: eternity for the dead, a fraction of 1/1000 of a second in the history of humanity

DPi.content: w/ DP, the third party, the State, its legal system are presumed to know, calculate, operate “time of death”: alignment of objective time w/ subjective time of subject condemned to death
DPi.linkedContent: w/ DP, the third party, the State, its legal system are presumed to know, calculate, operate “time of death”: alignment of objective time w/ subjective time of subject condemned to death

DPi.content: in absolute knowledge time is Tilgen not Aufheben (not merely sublated but suppressed)
DPi.linkedContent: in absolute knowledge time is Tilgen not Aufheben (not merely sublated but suppressed)

Gii.content: Heidegger: 2 hands clutch in haste, utilitarian violence (want #, quantity), don’t have patience of 1—the essential is not #, it’s the right time (die rechte Zeit)
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger: 2 hands clutch in haste, utilitarian violence (want #, quantity), don’t have patience of 1—the essential is not #, it’s the right time (die rechte Zeit)

TR.content: machine kills time & redeems fault by the work of the work at work
TR.linkedContent: machine kills time & redeems fault by the work of the work at work

TR.content: when it’s a matter of structure of text, concept of historicity not regulated by teleological process but by the event, by singularity of “one time only”
TR.linkedContent: when it’s a matter of structure of text, concept of historicity not regulated by teleological process but by the event, by singularity of “one time only”

TR.content: via de Man, time is not enough to make history, not the essential predicate of concept of history
TR.linkedContent: via de Man, time is not enough to make history, not the essential predicate of concept of history

AFR.content: for Condillac, time secures moment when object goes missing from perception, moment perception is absent from itself > moment space of signs opens, w/ function of imagination [time as that which absents perception?]
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, time secures moment when object goes missing from perception, moment perception is absent from itself > moment space of signs opens, w/ function of imagination [time as that which absents perception?]

AFR.content: for Condillac, there is no difference in general, only of degrees > this proposition comes to unfold (déplier) all concepts of rupture/repetition, this unfolding is time’s
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, there is no difference in general, only of degrees > this proposition comes to unfold (déplier) all concepts of rupture/repetition, this unfolding is time’s

AFR.content: for Condillac, repetition and absence of perceptual present to itself: gap or deviation of time > opens representative vection [desire] w/in sign & idea: suppléance as representation
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, repetition and absence of perceptual present to itself: gap or deviation of time > opens representative vection [desire] w/in sign & idea: suppléance as representation

HST.content: Levinas: “I” does not endow itself w/ this [temporal] alterity: impossibility of dialectical time is impossibility of saving oneself by oneself (alone)
HST.linkedContent: Levinas: “I” does not endow itself w/ this [temporal] alterity: impossibility of dialectical time is impossibility of saving oneself by oneself (alone)

HST.content: classical thesis of time (monad, event of negation) lacked thought of forgiveness (until Bergson & Heidegger)
HST.linkedContent: classical thesis of time (monad, event of negation) lacked thought of forgiveness (until Bergson & Heidegger)

LI.content: vices [turns] that interest me: time & place of the other time, the other time in (stead of) the first time, at once
LI.linkedContent: vices [turns] that interest me: time & place of the other time, the other time in (stead of) the first time, at once

TN.content: for Kant, time is a priori formal condition of all appearances > question of pure auto-affection in movement of temporalization
TN.linkedContent: for Kant, time is a priori formal condition of all appearances > question of pure auto-affection in movement of temporalization

BSi.content: for Celan, letting the other speak what in the other is most other: let time speak
BSi.linkedContent: for Celan, letting the other speak what in the other is most other: let time speak

OG.content: arche-writing at work in graphic and nongraphic expression, pattern uniting form & substance, all content & expression > opens temporalization, relationship w/ other & language
OG.linkedContent: arche-writing at work in graphic and nongraphic expression, pattern uniting form & substance, all content & expression > opens temporalization, relationship w/ other & language

OG.content: becoming-space of time, time of space, marks dead time w/in presence of living present > dead time is at work, les blancs take on importance > limit of phenomenology
OG.linkedContent: becoming-space of time, time of space, marks dead time w/in presence of living present > dead time is at work, les blancs take on importance > limit of phenomenology

OG.content: linearism, what Heidegger calls “vulgar concept of time,” inseparable form phonologism
OG.linkedContent: linearism, what Heidegger calls “vulgar concept of time,” inseparable form phonologism

OG.content: “line” only a particular model, vulgar, [acc. Heidegger] mundane concept of time in ontology from Aristotle to Hegel > meditation on writing & the deconstruction of the philosophy of history are inseparable
OG.linkedContent: “line” only a particular model, vulgar, [acc. Heidegger] mundane concept of time in ontology from Aristotle to Hegel > meditation on writing & the deconstruction of the philosophy of history are inseparable

UWC.content: figure of humanist: a response to the question of work, the theology of work secularizes time > the clock sometimes represents an attribute of the humanist [14th century]
UWC.linkedContent: figure of humanist: a response to the question of work, the theology of work secularizes time > the clock sometimes represents an attribute of the humanist [14th century]

SPEC.content: time, in Freud, must be thought in differential of pleasure–unpleasure, must be of the party (partie)
SPEC.linkedContent: time, in Freud, must be thought in differential of pleasure–unpleasure, must be of the party (partie)

SPEC.content: [re: fort/da]: selbstgeschaffene (self-invented) game, spontaneity, auto-production, self-engendering of repetition itself, hetero-tautology (definition of Hegelian speculative): gives time, there is time
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: fort/da]: selbstgeschaffene (self-invented) game, spontaneity, auto-production, self-engendering of repetition itself, hetero-tautology (definition of Hegelian speculative): gives time, there is time

SPEC.content: je le suppose relu [re: Freud’s Beyond…]—gagner le temps (or essential form of that which interests the speculation)
SPEC.linkedContent: je le suppose relu [re: Freud’s Beyond…]—gagner le temps (or essential form of that which interests the speculation)

SPEC.content: Freud’s auto-affective structure of time, life as the auto-affection of death, differance lodged in desire (desire nothing but this) for this auto-tely: auto-delegates & arrives only by differing in tout autre [for Freud, life-death announced to serve the proper, an economy of death]
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud’s auto-affective structure of time, life as the auto-affection of death, differance lodged in desire (desire nothing but this) for this auto-tely: auto-delegates & arrives only by differing in tout autre [for Freud, life-death announced to serve the proper, an economy of death]

SPEC.content: death drive doesn’t work in silence (like in French translation), but goes unnoticed (unauffällig), has to do w/ time (link to Kant, Aristotle)—thus rhythm: do feelings of tension exist to distinguish btwn bound/unbound energy or do they exist in relation to absolute magnitude?
SPEC.linkedContent: death drive doesn’t work in silence (like in French translation), but goes unnoticed (unauffällig), has to do w/ time (link to Kant, Aristotle)—thus rhythm: do feelings of tension exist to distinguish btwn bound/unbound energy or do they exist in relation to absolute magnitude?
